p: The percentage of root length infected with mycorrhiza was estimated by visual observation using a light microscope with 40 times magnification. Washed roots were cleared in 10% KOH and stained with 0.05% trypan blue in lactic acid ( v/ v), according to [ 32]. Root length infected by AM fungi was assessed using the magnified intersections method [ 33], where the frequency of colonization represents the ratio between the fragments of infected root and the total number of root fragments examined.
